intro: Wikstroemia johnplewsii, commonly known as the Johnplews' sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or white. The plant is adapted to grow in coastal sand dunes and rocky areas, showcasing its resilience to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
